de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller
Class ControllerFactory

java.lang.Object
  de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.ControllerFactory

public class ControllerFactory
extends java.lang.Object

ControllerFactory class is a factory for creating an instance of Controller.

Factory Pattern
Factories handle the details of object creation. This class has only one job in life: creating a controller object.

Notice, there're two different instances. The first is the actual controller while the 2nd is used to create worker threads to disburden the EDT. All layers on a higher level as the controller layer have to use the controller and controller background. Objects residing in the controller layer don't need to do this.

Singelton Pattern
This factory is based upon the Singleton pattern and creates only once the controllers.

Since:
Apr/07/09
Version:

Author:

Constructor Detail

ControllerFactory

public ControllerFactory()
Method Detail

getController

public static Controller getController()
creates an instance of the controller main class. The Controller is the only class holding a reference to model layer. It's needed to get access to data and it knows when actions are allowed or rejected.

Returns:
an instance of controller

getControllerBackgroundTask

public static ControllerBackgroundTask getControllerBackgroundTask()
gets the reference to the background tasks. Here run the long running processes in background threads to disburden the EDT (Event Dispatching Thread).

Returns:
controller for background task.
